Description: Faience scarab engraved with a hieroglyphic inscription of Rameses I, and on the back, an African's head.
Curator's comments: Description in Salzmann's letter: A group of ten objects. Either figurines, scarabs. Attribution to find-spot is based on Auguste Salzmann's letter to Charles Newton, dated 20 August 1860, in which he describes the contents of a paving hole near the Athena temple on Kamiros acropolis. The letter is kept in the Central Archives of the British Museum.
Bibliographic references: Gem / Catalogue of Engraved Gems & Cameos, Greek, Etruscan & Roman in the British Museum (260)
